title: Former Longhorn Pitches to Commercial Breaks
text:
Former Longhorn Pitches to Commercial Breaks Former Longhorn Pitches to Commercial Breaks Post to Facebook Former Longhorn Pitches to Commercial Breaks Former Longhorn Pitches to Commercial Breaks  //kvue.tv/1LwH84g   Former Longhorn Pitches to Commercial Breaks Shawn Clynch, KVUE 10 p.m. CDT October 15, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Billy "Sure" Schott is a Longhorn football legend who continues to live at least a part of his life on the sidelines. BIlly Schott, the TV timeout official KVUE 
The native of Austin grew up during a special time in Austin. A time in which football success was experienced all over the city. The Longhorns won national titles as did Reagan High School (Schott's) high school alma mater. 
Schott's was automatic as a kicker and it was automatic to assume he would partake in football officiating as his father did. 
He did just that and 6-years ago, Schott approached the head of Big 12 football officiating, Walt Anderson about the designated television timeout officiating position. 
The rest is history. 
Click on the video player for the story. Read or Share this story: http://kvue.tv/1LwH84g TOP VIDEOS
